page.title: 18FARMING (GENERAL) IN 1985
page.content: The land in this part of south Cheshire is flat, with heavy clay soils. These two factors and the mild damp climate mean that dairy farming is important. Most of the fields are permanent grass, both rough and improved grazing, or ley grass. There are a few fields of barley, grown for winter fodder. About one field in six has dairy cattle in it, at any one time. Occasionally there are sheep, or a bull, in a field. Most fields are surrounded by hedges and barbed wire, and some have electric fences to control the grazing. There are some areas of deciduous trees and a few ponds.
